message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $200.
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but $200 is quite a bit above my budget.  I'm very interested in the product, but I'm only able to offer $100 at this time.  Would you be willing to consider that?
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $100 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $180.
I appreciate you coming down in price, Alice.  While $180 is closer, I'm still a bit stretched.  I'd be happy to pay $150, which is closer to what I can afford.  What do you think?
I see you're getting closer to my target, Bob! I'm willing to meet you at $170, but I'm not willing to go any lower than that. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but $170 is still outside of my comfort zone. I'm willing to go up to $160, which is my absolute maximum. I'm hoping you'll consider this final offer.
I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $160 and $170, which is $165. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
